problem_text:
a) Is it true that for each word w, there is a function h : N × N →N such that the width of w in every finite p-group of Pr¨ufer rank r is bounded by h(p, r)?
 b) If so, can h(p, r) be made independent of p?
An affirmative answer to a) would imply A. Jaikin-Zapirain’s result (ibid.) that every word has finite width in each p-adic analytic pro-p group, since a pro-p group is p-adic analytic if and only if the Pr¨ufer ranks of all its finite quotients are uniformly bounded.
D. Segal
